tweets.text: Incredible public clean-up at Brent Reservoir. Among the tyres & tampons, items found inc a 30 yr-old crisp packet and a shotgun.  @CanalRiverTrust, @BarnetCouncil, @Brent_Council, @EnvAgency & @NaturalEngland now need to step up. Shameful long-term neglect. https://t.co/rGbj9fEKZi

tweets.text: We have been operating some of our flood storage reservoirs at #Lincoln and #Northampton this week storing water until high river flows have passed to help reduce flood risk to people and property. tweets.text: Heavy rain on the way for the new week - keep an eye on the @metoffice website for further #weather updates and impact warnings, and @EnvAgency website for flood and river updates #flooding #WeatherAware #warnings Amber alert for Pennines and Peak District https://t.co/h2JuWsmSnu

tweets.text:
How to turn a chalk stream into an open sewer, no, I'm not kidding.

The water course on the right is the River Wandle 1 of only 2 urban chalk streams in London. The 1 on the left is the rather aptly named "Beddington Effluent Carrier". https://t.co/0QYDEtY7tB
